website_summaries.verdict: Add some accessories, and the Raspberry Pi Zero W is a full PC for pocket change, but its potential for DIY electronic projects is its real draw.
pros: Costs less than a movie ticket
cons: Most connections require adapters, which come separately

customer_reviews.title: Be patient and install the correct software!!
customer_reviews.text: DONT get impatient or frustrated and tnink its DOA. It requires official RASPI image or custom kernel to use. This product is wonderful. Not as fast or customizable as a RPi3 but definitely as cool and usable. I have 3 SD cards set up with this already... 1. Raspi Debian Pixel (Jessie) for file serving and DLNA media server. 2. Retropie (with BT support for controller). 3. Kali (Re4S0n Image) for tech support / protesting. Also get an otg cable or hub for usb support. It's GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice combo pack
customer_reviews.text: Nice combo pack. The PiZeroW case being in hand with the ZeroW is a nice touch for those looking for getting a case right-away for their project. (If you need just a PiZeroW, this runs the price up a bit...fair warning) Filled a need for a project in-progress waiting for a bit more sophistication (An AdaFruit display hat) and the case was actually wanted/needed to protect the little board. The ZeroW makes things like wireless cameras, print servers, etc. VERY possible and if you're looking for a bit of maker magic, this is a good fit.
customer_reviews.author: Mad Scientist

customer_reviews.title: Great Pi, Nice Case
customer_reviews.text: First Pi would boot but only run for about 30 seconds, but the exchange was quick and seamless. Very nice and well fitting case also, wish it came in black to be less conspicuous.
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I finally came across a project I wanted to acquire a Zero for, and it worked like a charm! A UART cable and male-to-male cable are required for serial based programming. The case is well made, and offers a few cover options, dependent on the intent of one's project.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley M. Brown Jr.

customer_reviews.title: and it's nice to have three tops to choose from (closed
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two kits. The order shipped with two boards, but only one case. Also, one of the rubber feet doesn't stay on. For some reason, the adhesive came off. I think the case itself is well-designed, and it's nice to have three tops to choose from (closed, GPIO exposed, and camera). But you have to get the order right, folks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pi and case worked great.
customer_reviews.text: Raspberry Pi Zero W and case excellent condition. It was well packaged and come with a mini camera cable, three different case tops.
customer_reviews.author: JustAGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. The different face plates for the case are cool. There's a camera one, for example.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Special mini camera cable, all three covers and four rubber feet, works great!
customer_reviews.text: Mine came with a special mini camera cable, three covers and four rubber feet. Works, fits and tastes great! I paid $23.00 which seems a little bit pricey but it fits my Pi Zero W great. Almost missed the video cable!
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Very versitile.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent device. IT can be used for just about anything you can imagine. I'm using it and a camera module to create a wireless camera to fit onto an ETX 90 telescope. Made some very nice pics of the moon. waiting on the alignment to be best for pics of Jupiter and Mars. Great fun. Would recommend this for any enthusiast.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great if you don't need too much CPU power
customer_reviews.text: Using this to turn my IR devices on and off. Case is nice and small. Only problem i have had is that some microSD cards will cause the OS to not boot after about 5 reboots. But those same cards work just fine on a RPI 2/3.
customer_reviews.author: lego12

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was a little slow - held up by post office somewhere. But the part is great! Can't wait to program some stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Little

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad case
customer_reviews.text: This comes with a variety of lids and options. However, the camera hole is too small. You'll need a 5/16 drill to enlarge the hole slightly to accommodate a pi camera module. This product would be awesome of they enlarged the camera hole, added a pinhole for the board light to shine thru, and included a bottom half that did not expose the gpio holes.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Spiffy

customer_reviews.title: Great Combo!
customer_reviews.text: I have a rpi2, rpi3, rpi0, & now a rpi0w! By far one of my favorite pi's besides my rpi3, the case that comes with it is perfect, matches my rpi3. 😁
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Y.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice product - PI Zero W is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M. Glasnapp

customer_reviews.title: They work as expected
customer_reviews.text: A good way to get both parts, but a little expensive when everything is combine based on what they are supposed to cost
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Fantasic little device. I am using it to simply ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantasic little device. I am using it to simply monitor my network using a browser. Does what I want it to for the fraction of a full blown computer.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron J. Haughton

customer_reviews.title: Great bundle for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The Pi Zero W was perfect for my application! I didn't need the case, but this package ended up being the fastest/cheapest route to get my Pi Zero W. I did test out the case, and it worked perfectly. The Pi Zero W easily locked into place within the case. Mine came with multiple lids for a variety of applications, so you could access the GPIO pins, the camera connector with the included camera cable (but not the camera), and other pin access. I was able to plug in a usb hub and connect to HDMI without issue. The ports in the case perfectly match the Pi Zero. The Wifi works great!
customer_reviews.author: DJC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Little Computer!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazon said that it would arrive between March 28th, and April 3rd. IT ARRIVED ON THE 27th (which is especially impressive considering that I live in the U.S., and this product comes from overseas in the U.K.)!!!!!! I love the cases, and I love the computer. It is everything I hoped it to be, and more!
customer_reviews.author: Kerri

customer_reviews.title: Defective Case!
customer_reviews.text: Love the new RPI Zero W and this case looks amazing, but when the case is on and you try to plug in the HDMI it won't fit because the case is too thick. I have to take it off everytime I need to hook it up to a TV/Monitor. Other than that, this is an amazing product.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: case parts missing!
customer_reviews.text: This kit arrived with two of the three covers and no back. That is, it did NOT come with the official case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: DOA.....and yes i did all of the reccomended troubleshooting. Not even a rainbow screen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon user 1

product_meta.title: Raspberry Pi Zero W (Wireless) & Official Case
